Legal_Issue: PRRA Officer's misapprehension or misconstruing of evidence
Evidence_Assessment: Letter from Suleyman Goven was considered but given little weight due to lack of substantiation and bias
Burden_of_Proof: On the applicant to demonstrate risk of persecution
Credibility_Factor: Letter deemed potentially biased and unsubstantiated
Legal_Rule: Standard of review is patent unreasonableness for PRRA decisions on country conditions
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged misapprehension of evidence by PRRA Officer
Applicant_Challenge: PRRA Officer ignored or misconstrued evidence
Legal_Rule_Source: Canadian administrative law principles on standard of review
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board (PRRA Officer), Federal Court
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections related to PRRA and judicial review
Applicable_Process: Pre-removal risk assessment (PRRA) and subsequent judicial review
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Application for protection under PRRA process
Governing_Rule: Patent unreasonableness standard in administrative decision-making
